edu.lafayette.bci.devices

Class Parrot

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lafayette.bci.devices.Parrot

  • public class Parrot
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a control mechanism for the Parrot Ar.drone. It communicates with a node.js server (or the simulator) running on localhost port 5678. This server uses the nodecopter library to send control commands to the drone. The server must be running in order for this class to work.
    Author:
    Haley Garrison

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Parrot()
      Creates a new instance of Parrot and initializes the data stream for communicating with the server.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void backward(double speed)
      Pitches the drone backward at the specified speed.
      void clockwise(double speed)
      Yaws the drone clockwise at the specified speed.
      void close()
      Closes the output stream, ending communication with the server.
      void counterClockwise(double speed)
      Yaws the drone counter-clockwise at the specified speed.
      void down(double speed)
      Moves the drone downward at the specified speed.
      void forward(double speed)
      Pitches the drone forward at the specified speed.
      void hover()
      Stops all movement of the drone and makes it hover in place.
      void land()
      Causes the drone to land.
      void left(double speed)
      Rolls the drone left at the specified speed.
      void right(double speed)
      Rolls the drone right at the specified speed.
      void takeoff()
      Causes the drone to takeoff and hover a few feet above the ground
      void up(double speed)
      Moves the drone upward at the specified speed.
